data.title: Rename "translation" to "position" in Spatial?
data.body:
Godot 3.0

As I understand it, the Position2D and Position3D node is supposed to be a simple helper node to exchange positional information (e.g. in a tree where no other node has a get_position() method). However, unfortunately this class has no get_position() method of its own. I would find it very usefull to add a get_position() and set_position() method to it, so it could e.g. be used as a node for a camera (which is child to Position node) that follows a player controller (with a Position node as a child)  and other stuff.

data.title: Javascript Moving Loading Icon
data.body:
## Summary

The loading page, while a Godot Javascript game export is downloading, should have a moving loading icon.

## Explanation

Users have a hard time believing that a computer is doing something if there is nothing indicating that it is actually getting somewhere. Granted, Godot does say, "Loading Page...", but as it sits there saying that, the page looks completely frozen. If it is a larger game or is it is downloading over a slower network, the user is likely to kill the page because it looks like it hasn't gotten anywhere. It would be nice to have a rotating circle icon or something like that. Even if the icon is a gif and it doesn't actually indicate progress, I think it would make the user feel a lot better.

data.title: Javascript Full Page Games/Apps
data.body:
## Summary

It would be useful if there was an option on the Javascript export that would cause the game to run taking up the whole browser window instead of running in the exact resolution specified at export time.

## Explanation

There are a couple reasons this feature would be useful:

1. You could export games that would display correctly on screens of different sizes, densities, and aspect ratios. ( Assuming you designed the game correctly )
2. It would allow you to make web applications using Godot. You would get all of the power of the Godot game engine to easily design web applications or SPA's.

data.title: Expose zstd and zlib compression levels as global config.
Fixed compilation on Windows + removed debug print
data.body:
Nothing was returned by viewport_get_render_info so I added a `return`.
Also removed a spamming debug print that was slowing down procedural mesh generation.

data.title: Added EditorPlugin.remove_import_plugin()
data.body:
Allows addons with import extensions to clean up properly on removal, typically during `EditorPlugin._exit_tree()`.

Also, when using a gdscript based import plugin, the editor would segfault when quitting (as the plugin would be referenced after it is deleted) unless this function is used.

data.title: strange shadow glitches/artifacts when using spotlight
data.body:
Arch Linux, Godot 3.0 master, 
GPU: Intel HD4000 (Mesa 17.1.2)

I set up a simple scene using two TestCubes with a simple material and a spotlight (other lights don't do this) with shadows enabled and the resulting render has all those strange artifacts. Can anyone reproduce this or is this more likely a driver issue?

![godot3_shadows](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/27008896-c8c23ee8-4e7f-11e7-97c7-73ac3c1b4566.png)

data.title: Subtract body position from shape offset during tileset convert
data.body: To be able to adjust tile offset by changing position of StaticBody instead of modifying it maunally from the tres file or by calling a script. This way our tileset creating/converting workflow will be way more efficient.

data.title: Add touchpad pinch zooming support (2.1)
data.body:
Designed for touchpad users, make it possible to pinch zoom 2D canvas item editor.

A new button index constant is added to input event: GESTURE_MAGNIFY.

data.title: Possible Memory leak of unsigned char between PoolVector; ImageLoaderPNG, Ref<Texture> Editor_Icons::make_icon and default_theme.cpp
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch linux Godot 3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I was working on my terrain module and it crashed at random points, I did some debugging and found an index was 0 I went through my code and couldn't find the leak. I used valgrind, a powerful memory leak tool and ran it in -v (verbose) mode and it looks as though the leak isn't even in my own code. There appears to be some leak somewhere in themes, editor_icons, or the Ref<Image> . Either way the leak in godot is stopping me from developing the terrain module. Can you please have a look at my valgrind log and see what you can do about it?

Here's my valgrind log: https://paste.ee/p/s5NRN

There seems to be not just one or two, but literally thousands of leaks almost all of them to do with icons and themes.

Thank you in advance.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download the buggy alpha copy of terrain editor module: https://github.com/HumanSheeple/godot_heightmap_module
2. copy all the files to modules/hterrain
3. compile in qtcreator/scons for your appropriate OS
4. boot up godot
5. add new node, 3d spatial "heightmap"
6. rotate the camera around so you can see the terrain.
7. adjust the brush bars so you have a big brush and don't set the opacity too high
8. add some terrain, subtract some terrain, smooth some terrain, just generally mess about with it
9. at some random point it will crash the times are not consistent.

***UPDATE***:
I have done another valgrind -v --trace-children=yes --track-origins=yes --leak-check=full with NO TERRAIN module included using today Saturday 10 June 2017 build and valgrind appears to have found the same errors all but one, last nights test showed 954 blocks lost today only 953.
Here is a paste of the latest valgrind, again showing leaks with icons and themes: 
https://paste.ee/p/SrhdY
I hope this confirms this is definately not my code at fault!


***UPDATE 2***
14/06/17 https://paste.ee/p/6j4W6#a4Dm4cApVqpuU0tHiy8DPtmAKcbl6wwc I modified memory.h to output what cpp/h file was being called when a mem alloc and a mem free was done I also included the size of the memory allocations frees
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
***UPDATE 3***
15/06/17
We have isolated the leak to the resizing of PoolVector's

**Link to minimal example project:**
PoolVector<Vector3> pv;
            pv.push_back(Vector3());

data.title: Manually Specifying SSL Certificates
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

All platforms - 2.1.3-stable

**Issue description:**

Unless I am mistaken, it seems that all SSL certificates are loaded from a header file that is auto-generated by the build process. This prevents the use of self-signed certificates, which are extremely useful for testing or when using a CA is undesirable. A quick fix would be to bind "StreamPeerSSL::load_certs_from_memory", although a better solution might be to permit specifying a certificates file in the configuration file.

data.title: Add AT_LIGHT_PASS builtin to canvas shaders
data.body:
This one allows for complex shaders paired with a simple lighting shader to skip code that would otherwise be pointlessly (and wastefully) run during the light pass.

Depending on your game (number of items and lights), this can yield some performance gain.

__Bonus:__ Add initializer to some member, whose absence was making a crash. Keeping it in a separate commit is intended.

data.title: Rigidbodies in linked scenes use linked collision shapes, even if the collision shape is changed in the parent scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux - Godot 3.0, sha: d985dd6aedb855b6ea4ffa75756108aa4fee3518

**Issue description:**
In title

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a new scene with a rigidbody and a collision shape under it (SCENE_A)
2. Create another scene (SCENE_B) and add a linked node to SCENE_A
3. Toggle "Editable children" in the linked node in SCENE_B
4. Change the linked node's collision shape to something else
5. Test collision with the linked rigidbody, observe that it uses the original collider from SCENE_A and not the new one defined in SCENE_B

**Link to minimal example project:**
Quick example.  Note that the dropping cube passes through the new, larger platform
[CollisionExample.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1063093/CollisionExample.zip)

data.title: Add zstd compression support.
data.body:
zstd has much better compression speed and ratio, and better decompression speeds that currently available method.
Also set zstd as the default compression method for Compression as well as FileAccessCompressed methods.

Supersedes #8736.

data.title: script editor and resizing
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot 2.1 / 3

**Issue description:**
You have a big script and you click let's say in the second line and then scroll down so you can't see the second line. Then you do something and the script editor is resized, because you expand something like the output or you resize something else and the script editor changes it's size, **the script  editor scrolls back to the position you have clicked**. Wouldn't it be better if it stayed in the same place?

data.title: Editor now shows error when debug port is in use
data.body:
This PR fixes #9096 , well, actually it just notify the user that the editor cannot listen to the given host/port.

The cause for that could be more than just the port is in use, but I guess it's just the most common scenario.

The editor will still end up unable to catch output from the child process and the stop button will not work.
I don't know if there's a better fix to that second problem, but I'm pretty busy with work, and I don't have much time to fiddle around (I tried calling `stop()` immediately but it didn't work).

data.title: Add option for filtered texscreen (2.1)
data.body:
A bilinear-filtered screen texure allows you to do cheap 1:2 downsampling which can help in writing postprocessing shaders.

I'm not familiar with the 3.0 rasterizer yet, so I can't be sure this is relevant for _master_ or not.

data.title: Add optimizing AT_LIGHT_PASS builtin to canvas shaders (2.1)
data.body:
This one allows for complex shaders paired with a simple lighting shader to skip code that would otherwise be pointlessly (and wastefully) run during the light pass.

You can use `if (AT_LIGHT_PASS)`, negated or not, and that will be converted to a preprocessed #if when the shader is compiled.

Depending on your game (number of items and lights), this can be a *significant* performance gain, or at least avoids relying on the driver's optimizing abilities.

~~I don't think this is relevant for _master_.~~ @Zireael07 is right; now I'm porting it.

data.title: EditorPlugin can request user inputs from editor 3d view
data.body:
There is new method in EditorPlugin `set_input_event_forwarding_always_enabled()`. If plugin will use it then it will receive camera and input events of the editor 3d view in `forward_spatial_gui_input`. 
This changes might be handy if we want for example write plugin that will be able to fetch information from 3d scene without introducing any new node (originally we could get this info only when we were editing some node). 
This api was discussed with reduzio on IRC couple days ago.

data.title: Contact Monitor does not register contacts as expected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3 Godot Stable

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When I hit play and two bodies collide with a RigidBody2D with contact monitoring, and max contacts reported set to 2, it does not register both bodies at the same time.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download and play project. 
Change to set_max_contacts_reported(3) in order to register both bodies at the same time. 
It is expected to be able to handle 2 collisions when set to 2.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[rigid_body_2d_contact_monitor.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1061134/rigid_body_2d_contact_monitor.zip)
